00013 ORVReader::ORVReader()
00014 {
00015   fStreamVersion = ORHeaderDecoder::kUnknownVersion;
00016   fMustSwap = false;
00017 }

00019 size_t ORVReader::ReadPartialLineWithCR(char* buffer, size_t nBytesMax)
00020 {
00021   size_t pos = 0;
00022   while (pos < nBytesMax-1) {
00023     Read(buffer+pos, 1);
00024     if (buffer[pos] == '\n' || buffer[pos] == '\r') {
00025       pos++;
00026       break;
00027     }
00028     pos++;
00029   }
00030   if (buffer[pos-1] == '\r') buffer[pos-1] = '\n';
00031   buffer[pos] = '\0';
00032   return strlen(buffer);
00033 }
00034 
00035 bool ORVReader::ReadRecord(UInt_t*& buffer, size_t& nLongsMax)
00036 {
00037   bool stillOpen = true;
00038 
00039   stillOpen = ReadFirstWord(buffer, nLongsMax);
00040   if (!stillOpen) return false;
00041 
00042   // Handle header packets special-like for backwards compatibility
00043   if (fHeaderDecoder.IsHeader(buffer[0])) {
00044     ORLog(kDebug) << "Reading rest of header..." << std::endl;
00045     stillOpen = ReadRestOfHeader(buffer, nLongsMax);
00046     if (!stillOpen) return false;
00047   } else if (fBasicDecoder.IsLong(buffer)) {
00048     stillOpen = ReadRestOfLongRecord(buffer, nLongsMax);
00049     if (!stillOpen) return false;
00050   }
00051 
00052   if (ORLogger::GetSeverity() <= ORLogger::kDebug) { // check severity; improves speed
00053     char type = 'l';
00054     if (fHeaderDecoder.IsHeader(buffer[0])) type = 'h';
00055     else if (fBasicDecoder.IsShort(buffer)) type = 's';
00056     ORLog(kDebug) << "ReadRecord(): " << type << ": id = " 
00057                   << std::setw(11) << fBasicDecoder.DataIdOf(buffer) 
00058                   << "\tlen = " << fBasicDecoder.LengthOf(buffer) << std::endl;
00059   }
00060 
00061   return OKToRead();
00062 }
00063 
00064 size_t ORVReader::DeleteAndResizeBuffer(UInt_t*& buffer, size_t newNLongsMax)
00065 {
00066   delete [] buffer;
00067   buffer = new (std::nothrow) UInt_t[newNLongsMax]; // reallocation; deletion of buffer must be handled by calling procedure
00068   if(buffer == NULL) {
00069     ORLog(kFatal) << "Ran out of memory attempting to allocate buffer of length " 
00070                   << newNLongsMax << ". " << std::endl;
00071     exit(0);
00072   }
00073   return newNLongsMax;
00074 }
00075 
00076 void ORVReader::DetermineFileTypeAndSetupSwap(char* buffer)
00077 {
00078   fStreamVersion = fHeaderDecoder.GetStreamVersion(((UInt_t*) buffer)[0]);
00079   if (fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kOld) {
00080     fMustSwap = ORUtils::SysIsLittleEndian();
00081   }
00082   else if (fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kNewUnswapped) {
00083     fMustSwap = false; 
00084   }
00085   else if (fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kNewSwapped) {
00086     fMustSwap = true;
00087   }
00088   else if (fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kUnknownVersion) {
00089     ORLog(kError) << "The file type could not be determined from the header!" 
00090                   << std::endl << "Buffer in char was " << std::endl
00091                   << buffer[0] << buffer[1] << buffer[2] << buffer[3] 
00092                   << std::endl << "Buffer as hex was 0x" 
00093                   << std::hex << ((UInt_t*) buffer)[0] << std::dec << std::endl;
00094   }
00095 }
00096 
00097 bool ORVReader::ReadFirstWord(UInt_t*& buffer, size_t& nLongsMax)
00098 {
00099   if(nLongsMax < 4) {
00100     nLongsMax = DeleteAndResizeBuffer(buffer, 4);
00101   }
00102   if (Read((char*) buffer, 4) != 4) return false;
00103   if (!OKToRead()) return false;
00104   if(fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kUnknownVersion) {
00105     DetermineFileTypeAndSetupSwap((char*) buffer);
00106   }
00107   if (MustSwap()) {
00108     /* We always swap the first word for records except those of old headers,
00109      * which are no longer being created by Orca anyways.  All other swapping
00110      * is the responsibility of the decoder.  See ORVDataDecoder::Swap()*/
00111     if(!(fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kOld && 
00112          buffer[0] == fHeaderDecoder.FirstWordOldVersion())) {
00113       ORUtils::Swap(buffer[0]); 
00114     }
00115   }
00116   return true;
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 
00121 bool ORVReader::ReadRestOfHeader(UInt_t*& buffer, size_t& nLongsMax)
00122 {
00123   if(fStreamVersion == ORHeaderDecoder::kOld) {
00124     size_t lineBufferSize = 1024; // max Bytes for a single line
00125     char* lineBuffer = new char[lineBufferSize];
00126     memset(lineBuffer, 0, lineBufferSize);
00127     memcpy(lineBuffer, buffer, 4);
00128     ReadPartialLineWithCR(lineBuffer+4, lineBufferSize);
00129     std::string header = lineBuffer;
00130     while (std::string(lineBuffer) != "</plist>\n") {
00131       ReadPartialLineWithCR(lineBuffer, lineBufferSize);
00132       if (!OKToRead()) return false;
00133       //ORLog(kDebug) << "ReadLine retrieved:" << lineBuffer << std::endl;
00134       header += lineBuffer;
00135     }
00136     delete [] lineBuffer;
00137     UInt_t nBytes = header.size() + 1;
00138     UInt_t recordLength = ((UInt_t) ceil(double(nBytes)/4.0)) + 2;
00139     if(nLongsMax < recordLength) {
00140       nLongsMax = DeleteAndResizeBuffer(buffer, recordLength);
00141     }
00142     ORLog(kDebug) << "ReadRestOfHeader(): rec len = " << recordLength 
00143                   << ", nBytes = " << nBytes << std::endl;
00144     buffer[0] = recordLength;
00145     buffer[1] = nBytes;
00146     memcpy(buffer+2, header.c_str(), nBytes);
00147   }
00148   else {
00149     if(!ReadRestOfLongRecord(buffer, nLongsMax)) return false;
00150     // char strings don't end up swapped. 
00151     // we have to swap the second word since Header records have
00152     // 2 *header* words.  Most records have only one header word. 
00153     if (MustSwap()) ORUtils::Swap(buffer[1]);
00154   }
00155   return true;
00156 }
00157 
00158 
00159 
00160 bool ORVReader::ReadRestOfLongRecord(UInt_t*& buffer, size_t& nLongsMax)
00161 {
00162   /* No swapping happens here.  This *must* be done in the decoder. 
00163    * ORVReader takes care of first long word. */
00164   size_t longRecordLength = fBasicDecoder.LengthOf(buffer);
00165   if (longRecordLength > nLongsMax) {
00166     UInt_t tmp = buffer[0];
00167     nLongsMax = DeleteAndResizeBuffer(buffer, longRecordLength*2); // factor of 2 for margin 
00168     buffer[0] = tmp;
00169   }
00170   if (longRecordLength < 1) { 
00171     ORLog(kError) << "Record length is less than one!" << std::endl;
00172     return false; // We will have a problem here.
00173   }
00174   size_t nBytesToRead = (longRecordLength-1)*4;
00175   size_t nBytesRead = Read(((char*) buffer)+4, nBytesToRead);
00176   if (nBytesRead != nBytesToRead) {
00177     ORLog(kWarning) << "ReadRecord(): attempt to read " << nBytesToRead
00178                     << " B only returned " << nBytesRead << "B "
00179               << "(id = " << fBasicDecoder.DataIdOf(buffer) << ", "
00180               << "len = " << longRecordLength << ")" << std::endl;
00181     return false;
00182   }
00183   return true;
00184 }
